item.content:encoded: One, I'd suggest you get the best tile set you can, for bonus experience (you'll need a wooden set for Sue2, and an ashen set for Lil Rack, anyways). Then, practice using the flash game linked from the how to play. Trust me, it helps. Also, if you can, do higher difficulty games. You might still place 4th, but at least you get more exp for having done so. And finally, yes, you can outright buy allies (for that season, at least, you do lose them when you loop, even if you bribe them). Though it's 3 million for Lil Rack, 5 million for TACOS, etc (before party house discounts). Then again, as the recent news post stated, each time you lose against an ally, the price goes down by 2%. So for each time you lose against TACOS, the price would drop exactly as much as you paid to play that game (unless you played with RP…). Also of note is that if you beat an ally fair and square, the price for buying them in later seasons drops immediately down to the 10% minimum in later seasons.

item.title: Re: Manga reference
item.content:encoded: That's true, but it's also based on Saki (the first 3 allies are based on characters from Saki) and Akagi (K-Dog 2 is based on him), and the Dora Bomb seems to be from Legendary Gambler Tetsuya. It's based on multiple manga/anime, not just Koizumi.

item.title: Manga reference
item.content:encoded: A lot of this relates to "The Legend of Koizumi" manga/anime(Mudazumo Naki Kaikaku for you Japanese buffs). The Goumoupai and Rising Sun are Koizumi's signature moves.
